authentication.label: Authentication
authentication.title: Rainbow authentication portal
authentication.description:
# Rainbow authentication portal API guide

## Preamble

[Download Postman collection][0]

### Introduction

This guide describes list of API services that are provided by OT Rainbow authentication portal system. Services are used to manage OT Rainbow authentication.

### Protocol

REST interface is

endpoints.description: This API allows to get a validation status on a token.

This API allows Rainbow users to login.

The application is also authenticated during the user login.

The login provided by the user is matched against the loginEmail or the authenticationExternalUid

This API allows Rainbow users to logout.

Note: This API must not be called with ApiKey as authentication method.

This API allows Rainbow users to renew their JSON Web Token (<abbr title=\"JSON Web Token\">JWT</abbr>), thus
extending the expiration date of their current JWT.

This API requires user to be authenti

This API allows Rainbow users to know that URL they can use to perform a login.

The authentication URLs depends on the user and/or his company's setting:
- user can be configured to use:
  - Rainbow

This API realize the second authentication with a recovery code as second factor

If login is successful, the API returns a **JSON Web Token** (<abbr title=\"JSON Web Token\">JWT</abbr>) which has
to

This API realize the second authentication with a totp code as second factor

If login is successful, the API returns a **JSON Web Token** (<abbr title=\"JSON Web Token\">JWT</abbr>) which has
to be p

This endpoints allows applications to get authorization from Rainbow users to use Rainbow APIs
with their account. This delegation of access can be performed using OAuth 2.0 **Authorization code** gra

This endpoints allows applications to get an access token allowing them to use Rainbow APIs with
the account of the related Rainbow user.

Access token has a short lifetime (1 hour). A refresh token i

This API allows Rainbow users to login using OpenID Connect (OIDC) authentication (using authorization code grant)
if this type of authentication is provided by their company.

Authorization code gran

This API allows Rainbow users to logout using OpenID Connect (OIDC) authentication ([RP-Initiated Logout](https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-rpinitiated-1_0.html)).

In order to use this API:
- T

endpoints.summary: 1 - Get an access code to realize a passwordless login
endpoints.description:
This API allows the user to get a once-time access code (OTP) to be used for passwordless login.
This access code has then to be provided to the API [POST /api/rainbow/authentication/v1.0/passwordless

This API allows Rainbow users to use a once-time access code (OTP) in order to login to Rainbow.

This API is meant to be used by users configured to use passwordless authentication method:
- either t
This API allows Rainbow users to login using SAML authentication if this type of authentication is provided by their company.
Users can delete an API_KEY
Get an API_KEY
Users can change the API_KEY
Allow a user to get all his API_KEYs, or an administrator to get all API_KEYs of a user that he's responsible

endpoints.summary: Generate a new API_KEY for authentication
endpoints.description:
Users can create an API_KEY for authentication

The number of ApiKeys a user can create is limited to 100.
Get data of the currently used API_KEY

enduser.description:
# Rainbow end user portal API guide

## Preamble

[Download Postman collection][0]

### Introduction

This guide describes list of API services that are provided by OT Rainbow End user portal. This portal is dedicated to end user features.

### Protocol

REST interface is used for sending/receiving

endpoints.summary: Get user, company or bot avatar
endpoints.description:
This API can be used to retrieve users, companies or bots avatar.

Example: GET https://openrainbow.com/api/avatar/56c5c19f94141765119f896c?size=128

Clients can request avatars in a given size by spe

A user belonging to the 'Default' company is able to create his own company.
Then he is automatically moved to it and becomes the 'company_admin' of it.

The company's name is chec

This API allows users to get all companies.

Users with user role can only retrieve their own company and companies they can see (companies with visibility=p

This API allows users to list users being administrator of a company.

Users can only retrieve administrators of their own company and administrators of companies visible by their own co

This API allows user to get a company data.

Users can only retrieve their own company and companies they can see (companies with visibility=public, compani

For technical reasons, the same `limit` value applies on all peer to peer conversatio

admin.label: Admin Portal
admin.title: Rainbow admin portal
admin.description:
# Rainbow administrator portal API guide

## Preamble

[Download Postman collection][0]

### Introduction

This guide describes list of API services that are provided by OT Rainbow management portal system. Services are used to manage OT Rainbow system entities

### Protocol

REST interface is used

endpoints.summary: Get user, company or bot avatar
endpoints.description:
This API can be used to retrieve users, companies or bots avatar.

Example: GET https://openrainbow.com/api/avatar/56c5c19f94141765119f896c?size=128

Clients can request avatars in a given size by spe

This API allows administrators to delete a company.

Users with `superadmin` role can delete any company (except default and terminated companies).

Users with `bp_admin` or `bp_finance` role can only

Users with 'superadmin', 'support', 'customer_success_admin', 'sales_analytics' or 'business_admin' role can retrieve any company.
Users with admin role (and not having superadmin nor support

Users with superadmin role can update any company. Users with admin role (and not having superadmin role) can only update their own company.

Default and Terminated companies can't be renam

This API allows administrator to retrieve companies they can administrate.

Users with 'superadmin', 'support', 'customer_success_admin' or 'business_admin' role can retrieve all companies.

Only superadmin, BP admin, BP finance and organisation admin can create companies with this API.

Companies created by a `bp_admin` or a `bp_finance` (without organisation admin role) are a

This API allows administrators to list users being administrator of a company.

Users with `superadmin`, `support` role can list administrators from any company.

Users with `bp_
This API allows administrators to get service description pdf file uploaded by superadmin
See (Company gets a given theme)
See (Company updates a given theme)

This API allows administrators to list the features customisation elements for the company.

Retrieves the application features customisation elements (e.g. conversation pane, menu pane, se

This API allows administrators to set or update the feature customisation elements for the company.

These elements (e.g. conversation pane, menu pane, services) will then be available to t

This API allows to get the default Rainbow company.
Example: GET https://openrainbow.com/api/rainbow/admin/v1.0/companies/default

This API allows administrators to update properties for all company users (that could be categorized by using specific tag) among :
 - isActive

This API can be used to delete avatar image for a given companyId.

Only a superadmin is allowed to handle avatars for 'Default' and 'Terminated' companies.

This API can be used to upload avatar image for a given companyId

Rules:
- Avatar file has to be sent directly in http body (no JSon).
- Only **jpeg**, **jpg** and **png** files are supported. Approp

This API can be used to retrieve company's background (logo).
Example: GET https://openrainbow.com/api/backgrounds/625eace8edc658748e53c2d2?size=128

Client can request backgrounds in

This API can be used to delete avatar image for a given companyId.

Only a superadmin is allowed to handle avatars for 'Default' and 'Terminated' companies.

This API can be used to upload banner image for a given companyId

Rules:
  • Banner file has to be sent directly in http body (no JSon).
  • Only jpeg, jpg and png<

This API can be used to retrieve company's banner in addition to the logo retrieved via /api/avatar/{companyId}.
Example: GET https://openrainbow.com/api/banner/56c5c19f94141765119f896c?size=128
This API allows to delete a Calendar.

This API allows to get a calendar for a given company
Example: GET https://openrainbow.com/api/rainbow/admin/v1.0/companies/5cd545b3a07de465fb123456/calendars/5cd545b3a07de465fb185969

This API allows to modify settings of a Calendar.
Modification can be done on the following settings of a calendar:
  • Calendar name
  • Calendar office hours:
    • The "op

This API allows to get all the calendars for a given company
Example: GET https://openrainbow.com/api/rainbow/admin/v1.0/companies/5cd545b3a07de465fb123456/calendars?limit=100&offset=0&sortField
This API allows to create a new Calendar.

This API allows to modify mode of a Calendar.
Modification will be forwarded to welcome services linked to it if the company have a Cloud PBX:
You can force to open when you're closed (at th

This API allows to get all the groups of a Cloud PBX for a given company
Example: GET https://openrainbow.com/api/rainbow/admin/v1.0/companies/5cd545b3a07de465fb123456/groups?limit=100&offset=0&
This API allows to get data of a Cloud PBX group

This API is still working, but customData management can now be done directly
at company creation (using API [POST /api/rainbow/admin/v1.0/companies](#api-companies-PostCompanies)
or with a company up

endpoints.summary: Get all sites linked with this company
endpoints.description:
This API allows administrator to retrieve sites linked to a given company

superadmin and support get sites linked to all companies existing in Rainbow.

This API can be used to retrieve company's splash screen in addition to the logo retrieved via /api/avatar/{companyId}.
Example: GET https://openrainbow.com/api/splashscreen/56c5c19f94141765119f
This API can be used to delete splash screen image for a given companyId.

endpoints.summary: Get information of company's splash screen
endpoints.description:
This API can be used to get some information of splash screen image for a given companyId
Note: If the company has no splash screen, this API return the splash screen of its BP company.

This API can be used to upload splash screen image for a given companyId

Rules:
  • Splash screen file has to be sent directly in http body (no JSon).
  • Only jpeg

endpoints.summary: Choose the default company's splash screen or the uploaded one
endpoints.description: This API can be used to choose the default or the uploaded splash screen image for a given companyId

endpoints.summary: Apply a templates to a company or a user
endpoints.description:
This API allows an administrator to apply an application customisation template to a company or a user

## Why is an application template?
- An application template is a set of key feature controlled

This API allows an administrator to create an application customisation template for the given company.

- The name of the template must be unique among all of its belonging to the company.
- The temp

This API allows administrator to retrieve application customisation templates supported by a given company.

`superadmin` and `support` can get templates available for any company (the requested compa

This API allows an administrator to delete an application customisation template.

Users with `superadmin` role can delete any private template.

Users with `bp_admin` or `admin` role can only delete

This API allows administrator to retrieve the requested application customisation template

Example: GET https://openrainbow.com/api/rainbow/admin/v1.0/customisations/templates/5d3704dc78ef1b101f69a01
This API allows an administrator to update an application customisation template. `A public template can't be updated using this API. Update is only allowed via a database migration.` `On

endpoints.summary: Ask monitoring info about a guardian action done onto company identified by companyId
endpoints.description: This API can be used to monitor on going actions around guardian crisis
This API can be used to start a guardian crisis

applications.label: Applications
applications.title: Rainbow Application Portal
applications.description:
# Rainbow application portal API guide

## Preamble

[Download Postman collection][0]

### Introduction

This guide describes list of API services that are provided by OT Rainbow Application portal. This portal is dedicated to app features.

### Protocol

REST interface is used for sending/receiving

endpoints.summary: Create an application push notification settings.
endpoints.description: This API allows to create application push notification settings.

endpoints.summary: Get all application push notification settings data.
endpoints.description: This API allows to get all application push notification settings.

endpoints.summary: Delete an application push notification settings
endpoints.description: This API allows to delete an application push notification settings.

endpoints.summary: Get an application push notification settings data.
endpoints.description: This API allows to get an application push notification settings.

endpoints.summary: Update an application push notification settings
endpoints.description: This API allows to update an application push notification settings.

endpoints.summary: Get all applications created (in deployment or deployed) by the user.
endpoints.description:
This API can be used to retrieve the list of applications created by the user.
User with only bp_finance role can only retrieve applications: - owned by an app_admin bel
Rainbow users can create their own applications.

Rainbow developers can restart their own applications.

If application's kpi is "rainbowstore", then "restart" should use rainbowstore APIs.

Rainbow users can stop their own applications.

If application's kpi is "rainbowstore", then "stop" should use rainbowstore APIs.

Rainbow developers can delete their own applications.

If application's kpi is "rainbowstore", then deletion should use rainbowstore APIs.

app_admin can see their own applications and applications belonging to other developers of their
company.
Rainbow users can update their own applications.

endpoints.summary: Request the deployment of an application.
endpoints.description:
Rainbow users can update their own applications.

If application's kpi is "rainbowstore", then the deployment should use rainbowstore APIs.
If application's kpi is "appconnect",

endpoints.summary: Get an embed frame for application.
endpoints.description: This API allows a user to generate an iframe to embed  Rainbow application.

endpoints.summary: Get an embedding frame for application.
endpoints.description: This API allows to get an embedding iframe with a target URL.

endpoints.summary: Confirm that a user has requested a developer account creation.
endpoints.description:
This API can be used to confirm that a user has requested a developer account creation.
Used only in the 2 steps onboarding scenario. See (#applications/developers:applications/developers/PostRegister

endpoints.summary: Allows a developer to send feedback.
endpoints.description: This API allows a developer to send a feedback.

endpoints.summary: Allows a developer to choose offer by email.
endpoints.description: This API allows a developer to choose.

endpoints.description:

superadmin can list invoices being available to any company existing in Rainbow.

This API retrieves an invoice file available on Zuora. The file is in PDF format.

superadmin can get invoice files belonging to any company existing in Rainbow.
bp

Get an offer from its id

The requested offer must be in the requested company's assigned catalog, otherwise an error 403 is returned.

This API retrieves the list of offers available to the requested company.
The available offers for a company corresponds to the offers being in the catalog assigned to this company.

endpoints.summary: Create a quotation for a company and an offer
endpoints.description:
This API can be used to create a quotation for a given offer for a given company (creation of a subscription in preview mode).

superadmin can create quotation for any company

This API can be used to upload pre paid offers from ACTIS file, to set in the given company subscriptions.
Rules:
  • ACTIS file has to be sent directly in http body (no JSon).

/!\ For now, only resell model is managed (i.e. a bp_finance of BP VAD/IR/DR buy a subscription for one of his customer companies (EC)
or bp_finance of BP VAD buy a subscription for one of his BP IR).

This API can be used to list all subscriptions subscribed by a company.
All companies have at least a subscription to the default (free) offer.

superadmin, busines

superadmin can delete subscriptions for every company. superadmin can delete subscriptio

superadmin and support can get subscriptions of all companies existing in Rainbow.
business_a

This API can be used to update a given company subscription.

Currently only maxNumberUsers can be updated, so update is restricted to subscriptions linked to offers having bus

This API can be used to get features available to the company through its subscriptions.

Subscriptions bring to the company features (through a profile depending of the subscribed offer).
Each subscr

This API can be used to list counters regarding all offers subscribed by a BP company and its customers / resellers.
This API can only be used for BP companies (whatever the bpType).

This API can be used to get default subscription of a company (i.e. subscription to default Rainbow offer).

superadmin, business_admin and support ca

This API can be used to list prepaid subscriptions ending soon

superadmin and support can list prepaid subscriptions of any company(ies) existing in Rainbow.

superadmin and support can get users attached to any company subscriptions existin

endpoints.description:

Example: POST https://sandbox.openrainbow.com/api/rainbow/rvcpprovisioning/v1.0/cloudpbxs/5c9e2be00d9ebd10f0dad5e6/phone-numbers

endpoints.summary: Disassociate MAIN DDI number from a Rainbow user
endpoints.description:
This API allows to disassociate MAIN DDI number from a Rainbow user.
Example: DELETE https://sandbox.openrainbow.com/api/rainbow/rvcpprovisioning/v1.0/cloudpbxs/5c9e2be00d9ebd10f0dad5e6/phone-nu

endpoints.summary: Delete a DDI number for a given CloudPBX
endpoints.description:
This API allows to delete a DDI number for a CloudPBX.
> Note : Default DDI can be deleted only if it is the last DDI of the CloudPBX
Example: DELETE https://sandbox.openrainbow.com/api/rain

endpoints.summary: List DDI numbers associated to a CloudPBX
endpoints.description:
This API allows to get the list of DDI numbers associated to a CloudPBX.
Example: GET https://sandbox.openrainbow.com/api/rainbow/rvcpprovisioning/v1.0/cloudpbxs/5c9e2be00d9ebd10f0dad5e6/phone-n

This API allows to create a DDI number for a CloudPBX.
Example: POST https://sandbox.openrainbow.com/api/rainbow/rvcpprovisioning/v1.0/cloudpbxs/5c9e2be00d9ebd10f0dad5e6/phone-numbers/ddi

endpoints.summary: Get unassigned CloudPBX internal phone numbers
endpoints.description: This API allows to list all unassigned internal phone numbers for a given CloudPBX system.

endpoints.summary: Set DDI as default CloudPBX DDI
endpoints.description:
This API allows to set a DDI number as default DDI for a CloudPBX.
Example: POST https://sandbox.openrainbow.com/api/rainbow/rvcpprovisioning/v1.0/cloudpbxs/5c9e2be00d9ebd10f0dad5e6/phone-number

endpoints.summary: Set DDI as default CloudPBX site DDI
endpoints.description:
This API allows to set a DDI number as default DDI for a CloudPBX site. If it's already the site default DDI, it will be remove as the default one
Example: POST https://sandbox.openrainbow.com/a

Complete deletion of the requested recording, descriptor and audio file.
Example: DELETE https://sandbox.openrainbow.com/api/rainbow/rvcpprovisioning/v1.0/cloudpbxs/5fc2a9c2c6bda124728ae60b/rec

Retrieve the requested recording
It can invoked in two ways:
  • By requesting with 'Accept: application/json' HTTP header: The returned resource will be the record descriptor in JSON forma

Deletion of the provided list of recording
Example: DELETE https://sandbox.openrainbow.com/api/rainbow/rvcpprovisioning/v1.0/cloudpbxs/5fc2a9c2c6bda124728ae60b/recordings?recordIds=4b3f58bdc9fe

Retrieve the cloudpbx's recordings
Please refer to local regulations to check if recording conversations is permitted by law.
Recording can be activated on cloud PBX users by a
Retrieve cloudpbx's recording settings
Set the cloudpbx's recording settings

endpoints.summary: Get recordings (scope can be an entire organization)
endpoints.description:
Retrieve recordings according filters (Scope is the entire list of companies manageable by LoggedIn user)

Note that this API can be used only by SuperAdmin or Organization Admin

endpoints.summary: Activate or deactivate the recording for the subscriber
endpoints.description: Activate or deactivate subscriber's recordings

endpoints.summary: Assign a SIP Device to a CloudPBX subscriber
endpoints.description:
This API allows to assign a SIP device to a CloudPBX Subscriber.
The device must have been previously created.
Assigning a device to a subscriber can de done by specifying the device Id (pre

endpoints.summary: Get all SIP devices assigned to a subscriber
endpoints.description:
This API allows administrator to retrieve all SIP devices assigned to a subscriber

superadmin and support can get all devices existing in Rainbow.
bp_

endpoints.summary: Create a CloudPBX Subscriber for a Rainbow User.
endpoints.description:
This API allows to create a new CloudPBX Subscriber for a Rainbow User.
This new subscriber will appear as a new entry into "phoneNumbers" list of the targeted Rainbow User.
As a result, t

endpoints.summary: Delete a CloudPBX Subscriber (identified by its phone Number identifier)
endpoints.description:
This API allows to delete a CloudPBX Subscriber. All its associated SIP devices become free for other subscribers.
Example: DELETE https://sandbox.openrainbow.com/api/rainbow/rvcpprovisioning/v1

This API allows to get data of a CloudPBX Subscriber
Example: GET https://sandbox.openrainbow.com/api/rainbow/rvcpprovisioning/v1.0/cloudpbxs/5c6aeb5b7817b9050c517e20/subscribers/5c790e7b722ee82

endpoints.summary: Remove association between subscriber and SIP device
endpoints.description:
This API allows to remove association between subscriber and the Sip Device (SIP device becomes available for another subscriber)
Example: DELETE https://sandbox.openrainbow.com/api/rainbow/rvcp

endpoints.summary: Get a specific SIP device assigned to a subscriber
endpoints.description:
This API allows administrator to retrieve a given SIP device assigned to a subscriber

superadmin and support can get all devices existing in Rainbow.

endpoints.summary: Get info on all registered SIP devices for a subscriber
endpoints.description:
This API allows administrator to retrieve registrations info on all devices registered for a subscriber

superadmin and support can get all registrations info exis

This API allows to get CLI policy of a CloudPBX Subscriber
Example: GET https://sandbox.openrainbow.com/api/rainbow/rvcpprovisioning/v1.0/cloudpbxs/5c6aeb5b7817b9050c517e20/subscribers/5c790e7b7

This API allows to get PSTN Device options of a CloudPBX Subscriber
Example: GET https://sandbox.openrainbow.com/api/rainbow/rvcpprovisioning/v1.0/cloudpbxs/5c6aeb5b7817b9050c517e20/subscribers/
This API allows to update PSTN Device options of a CloudPBX Subscriber

This API allows to get custom SIP headers of a CloudPBX Subscriber
Example: GET https://sandbox.openrainbow.com/api/rainbow/rvcpprovisioning/v1.0/cloudpbxs/5c6aeb5b7817b9050c517e20/subscribers/5
This API allows to update custom SIP headers of a CloudPBX Subscriber
This API allows to update traffic barring options of a CloudPBX Subscriber

endpoints.summary: Configure the external call forward options
endpoints.description: This API allows configure the authorization on external call forward of a CloudPBX Subscriber

endpoints.summary: Update overflow configuration of a subscriber
endpoints.description: This API allows to update overflow data of a CloudPBX Subscriber

endpoints.summary: Get the overflow status of a subscriber
endpoints.description: This API allows to get overflow data of a CloudPBX Subscriber

endpoints.summary: Delete a welcome or welcome service
endpoints.description:
This API allows to delete a Cloud PBX Welcome (DEPRECATED) or Welcome Service.
Example: DELETE https://sandbox.openrainbow.com/api/rainbow/rvcpprovisioning/v1.0/cloudpbx

endpoints.summary: Update a Welcome or Welcome Service
endpoints.description:
This API allows to update a Cloud PBX Welcome (DEPRECATED) or Welcome Service.
Example: POST https://sandbox.openrainbow.com/api/rainbow/rvcpprovisioning/v1.0/cloudpbxs/

endpoints.summary: Get a Welcome of a specific system
endpoints.description: Will be replace by {get} /api/rainbow/admin/v1.0/companies/:companyId/calendars/:calendarId  Get a company calendar with backend 203
Will be replace by {get} /api/rainbow/admin/v1.0/companies/:companyId/calendars/:calendarId  Get a company calendar with backend 203
Will be replace by {put} /api/rainbow/admin/v1.0/companies/:companyId/calendars/:calendarId  Update a company calendar with backend 203

endpoints.summary: Get all Welcome services for a specific system
endpoints.description: This API allows to get data of a all Welcome services of a specific system

This API allows to create a new CloudPBX Welcome Service.
Example: POST https://sandbox.openrainbow.com/api/rainbow/rvcpprovisioning/v1.0/cloudpbxs/5c6aeb5b7817b9050c517e20/ivrs/welcomeservices

endpoints.summary: Get all Welcomes of a specific system
endpoints.description: Will be replace by {get} /api/rainbow/admin/v1.0/companies/:companyId/calendars/:calendarId  Get all company calendars with backend 203
Will be replace by {post} /api/rainbow/admin/v1.0/companies/:companyId/calendars  Create a company calendar with backend 203

endpoints.summary: Create a voicemail greeting for a group
endpoints.description:
This API can be used to create a voicemail greeting for a cloudpbx's group.
Request body must contain audio file content.

endpoints.summary: Retrieve voicemail greetings for a group
endpoints.description: This API can be used to retrieve customized voicemail greetings for a cloudpbx's group.

endpoints.summary: Delete a voicemail greeting for a group
endpoints.description: This API can be used to delete a voicemail greeting for a cloudpbx's group.

endpoints.summary: Retrieve a voicemail greeting (audio file) for a group
endpoints.description: This API can be used to retrieve a voicemail greeting (audio file) for a cloudpbx's group.

endpoints.summary: Update audio file associated to a voicemail greeting
endpoints.description:
This API can be used to update the audio file associated to a voicemail greeting.
Request body must contain audio file content.

endpoints.summary: Retrieve an external SIP trunk using its unique identifier (available also for Hybrid Trunk)
endpoints.description: This API allows to retrieve an external SIP trunk using its identifier (available also for Hybrid Trunk)

endpoints.summary: Retrieve a list of external SIP trunks (including Hybrid Trunks)
endpoints.description: This API allows superadmin, bp_admin, company_admin or organisation_admin to retrieve a list of external SIP trunks (including Hybrid Trunks)
